title: Charred Cabbage with Salty Peanuts & Nuoc Cham
ingredients: 1head purple or green cabbage (3 to 3½ pounds)
¾cup packed cilantro leaves and tender stems
directions: 1. Position a rack in the lower third of the oven and preheat the oven to 450°F.

2. Char the cabbage:- Remove any wilted outer leaves from the cabbage. Quarter it through the core.- Place quarters in a large bowl, drizzle with 3 tablespoons olive oil, and toss to coat. Season generously with salt.- Heat a 12-inch cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until very hot, about 4 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil, swirl to coat.- Arrange cabbage wedges in the skillet and cook undisturbed until deeply golden on the bottom, 8 to 10 minutes. Reserve the bowl.- Flip wedges, then transfer skillet to the oven. Roast 30 to 40 minutes, until tender and golden brown on the bottom.

3. Make the nuoc cham:- In the reserved bowl, squeeze the juice from 3 limes. Add 3 tablespoons sugar, 3 tablespoons fish sauce, and ½ teaspoon salt.- Thinly slice 2 Fresno chiles and add them.- Finely grate in 1 garlic clove.- Finely chop ½ cup peanuts and set aside.

4. Marinate the cabbage:- Transfer cabbage to a cutting board and let cool 5 minutes. Cut each wedge in half crosswise.- Transfer to a large shallow bowl, season again with salt, and pour over the nuoc cham. Turn to coat.
5. Serve:- Top with ¾ cup cilantro leaves and the chopped peanuts. Serve warm or at room temperature.
